ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Basic cti file input-help please
ygData.msgSnippet: There are diagnostics for problems like this in Python (but not Matlab). In python, do: gas = importPhase( , debug=1) This will print out diagnostic

	delsp=yes;

There are diagnostics for problems like this in Python (but not Matlab).

In python, do:

gas = importPhase(<cti file>, debug=1)

This will print out diagnostic information about file names, etc.  
Other than that, it seems these types of problems usually occur on  
Windows PCs, and usually in Matlab. I would suggest trying it on  
linux or on a Mac, or from Python instead of Matlab.

Dave


On Mar 24, 2007, at 8:00 AM, Ron Besser wrote:

> All,
> I am using Cantera in Matlab r2006b.
> I am having trouble with inputting my own cti files.
> I can't get my own cti files to read in. If I read in one of the  
> pre-existing files, e.g., argon.cti,
> air.cti, h2o2.cti, etc., there is no problem.
> I even tried going in and modifying a copy of one of these, with  
> even a minimal modification, for example changing:
>
> ideal_gas(name = "ohmech"
>
> to:
>
> ideal_gas(name = "ohm"
>
> and the file cannot be read in.
>
> Here I copied h2o2.cti to h2o23.cti in the same directory (C: 
> \Program Files\Common Files\Cantera\data\) and made the change. I  
> run the following line and get the following errors. Can someone help?
>
> Many thanks,
> Ron Besser
>
> >> gas = importPhase('h2o23.cti','ohm')
> ???
> ************************************************
>                 Cantera Error!
> ************************************************
>
> Procedure: xml_find_id
> Error:   id not found: ohm
> Error in ==> XML_Node.findByID at 4
> index = ctmethods(10, 8, root.id, id);
> Error in ==> Solution.Solution at 34
>   node = findByID(doc,id);
> Error in ==> importPhase at 7
>   s = Solution(file, name);
>
> Get your own web address.
> Have a HUGE year through Yahoo! Small Business. 


--Apple-Mail-16-1021018284
